title: E&C Leaders Request GAO Examine Issues at DOE Affecting Progress on Reducing Environmental Liabilities
description: Washington, D.C. — House Energy and Commerce Committee Republican Leader Cathy McMorris Rodgers (R-WA), Energy and Commerce Committee Chairman Frank Pallone, Jr. (D-NJ), Energy Subcommittee Republican Leader Fred Upton (R-MI), Energy Subcommittee Chairman Bobby L. Rush (D-IL), Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee Republican Leader Morgan Griffith (R-VA), and Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee Chair Diana DeGette (D-CO) wrote to the Government Accountability Office (GAO) today requesting an examination of management challenges and other issues at the Department of Energy’s (DOE) Office of Environmental Management (EM) that have affected EM’s ability to reduce its...

title: Leader Guthrie on the Need to Address Fentanyl-Related Substances to Save Lives
description: Washington, D.C. — Health Subcommittee Republican Leader Brett Guthrie (R-KY) delivered the following remarks in a Health Subcommittee hearing remarks in a Health Subcommittee hearing entitled, “The Overdose Crisis: Interagency Proposal to Combat Illicit Fentanyl-Related Substances.”

title: Leader Rodgers: We need to take this urgent action on fentanyl analogues
description: “It is too deadly a substance to be weak on traffickers and those who sell it to children in our communities.”

title: Rodgers, Latta Applaud Bipartisan Legislation to Improve Cybersecurity and Ensure American Leadership in Next Generation Communications Technology
description: Washington, D.C. – House Energy and Commerce Committee Republican Leader Cathy McMorris Rodgers (R-WA) and Republican leader for Communications and Technology Bob Latta (R-OH) released the following statement on the passing of bipartisan legislation to improve cybersecurity and ensure American leadership in next generation communications technology.

title: Bipartisan E&C Leaders Remind the Olympic Community of its Legal Obligations to Report Allegations of Sexual Abuse
description: The Committee’s Letters Follow Troubling Information that USA Badminton May Have Failed to Report Allegations of Child Sexual Abuse, Discouraged Others from Reporting the Allegations, and May Be Obstructing an Investigation

title: Leader Rodgers: “Big Tech Should not be the Arbiters of Truth—Not for me, my Community, our Children, or any American”
description: Washington, D.C.--House Energy and Commerce Committee Republican Leader Cathy McMorris Rodgers condemned Big Tech censorship today at a Communications and Technology Subcommittee hearing on holding Big Tech accountable for censoring free speech.

title: Leader Latta: E&C Republicans are Leading to Hold Big Tech Accountable for Censorship
description: Washington, D.C.--House Energy and Commerce Committee Republican leader for Communications and Technology Bob Latta (R-OH) called out Big Tech censorship today at a subcommittee hearing on Section 230 reform.

title: Leader Rodgers Stands Up for Life in Front of the Supreme Court
description: “Let’s make today a new opportunity to bring healing. To bring hope!”

title: Holding Big Tech Accountable: Legislation to Build a Safer Internet
The Future of Biomedicine: Translating Biomedical Research into Personalized Health Care
